tools.name: Signal
tools.description: Private messaging app with end-to-end encryption. Open source and nonprofit.

tools.name: Element
tools.description: Secure collaboration and messaging app powered by Matrix protocol.

tools.name: Mozilla Firefox
tools.description: Privacy-focused web browser from Mozilla. Open source with strong tracking protection.

tools.name: Brave Browser
tools.description: Privacy browser that blocks ads and trackers by default. Built on Chromium.

tools.name: DuckDuckGo
tools.description: Privacy-focused search engine that doesn't track your searches.

tools.name: Startpage
tools.description: Private search engine that shows Google results without tracking.

tools.name: ProtonMail
tools.description: Secure email service with end-to-end encryption based in Switzerland.

tools.name: Tutanota
tools.description: Encrypted email service that's open source and ad-free.

tools.name: Nextcloud
tools.description: Self-hosted productivity platform with file sync, calendar, contacts, and more.

tools.name: Syncthing
tools.description: Continuous file synchronization between devices. P2P and encrypted.

tools.name: Mullvad VPN
tools.description: VPN service focused on privacy with anonymous accounts and wireguard.

tools.name: IVPN
tools.description: Privacy-first VPN service with strong no-logs policy and transparent audits.

tools.name: Mastodon
tools.description: Decentralized social network running on the Fediverse. Twitter alternative.

tools.name: Lemmy
tools.description: Decentralized link aggregator and forum (Reddit alternative).

tools.name: /e/ OS
tools.description: Privacy-focused mobile OS based on Android, de-Googled with microG.

tools.name: GrapheneOS
tools.description: Privacy and security focused mobile OS with Android compatibility.

tools.name: Standard Notes
tools.description: End-to-end encrypted note-taking app with extensions and markdown.

tools.name: Joplin
tools.description: Open source note-taking app with end-to-end encryption and sync.

tools.name: Bitwarden
tools.description: Open source password manager with end-to-end encryption and self-hosting.

tools.name: KeepassXC
tools.description: Offline, open source password manager. Stores passwords locally.

tools.name: Tor Browser
tools.description: Anonymous web browser that routes traffic through the Tor network.

tools.name: LibreWolf
tools.description: Privacy-focused Firefox fork with enhanced tracking protection.

tools.name: Searx
tools.description: Privacy-respecting metasearch engine that can be self-hosted.

tools.name: Proton VPN
tools.description: Secure VPN service from Proton with free tier and strong encryption.

tools.name: Delta Chat
tools.description: Chat over email using existing email servers. No registration needed.
